intro: Diclidanthera elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has slender, erect stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Diclidanthera elliptica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
